set.explicate: (v.) to make plain or clear, explain; to interpret
set.implicate: (v.) to involve in; to connect with or be related to
set.introspective: (adj.) contemplating one's own thoughts and feelings
set.perspicuity: (adj.) clearness or lucidity, as of a statement
set.specious: (adj.) deceptive, apparently good or valid but lacking real merit
set.speculate: (v.) form a theory about a subject without firm evidence
set.actuate: (v.) to move to action; to impel
set.beset: (v.) (of a problem) trouble or threaten persistently.
set.dire: (adj.) (of a situation or event) extremely serious or urgent
set.fervent: (adj.) having or displaying a passionate intensity
set.fester: (v.) to grow embittered over time; to rot
set.zealous: (adj.) enthusiastic, marked by passionate support for a person, cause, or ideal
